definition[0]: to move or pass easily through water or air
example[0]: The boat cut effortlessly through the water.
definition[1]: to quickly and easily deal with something that is confusing or difficult
example[1]: You need someone to help you cut through all the irritating legal jargon.
definition[2]: if a sound cuts through silence or noise, it is heard because it is loud
example[2]: A piercing shriek cut through the silence.
